text:
I try to replace from a String everything except lowercase ascii characters.

let
    s = "^hello 位world_?"
    replace(s, r"[^a^b^c^d^e^f^g^h^i^j^k^l^m^n^o^p^q^r^s^t^u^v^w^x^y^z^\s]" => "")
end

For some reason the ^ character stays: "^hello world"

What am I doing wrong? (Julia 1.5.1)

elements.text:

    s = "^hello 位world_?"
    replace(s, r"[^a^b^c^d^e^f^g^h^i^j^k^l^m^n^o^p^q^r^s^t^u^v^w^x^y^z^\s]" => "")

text: Hi, I think this question is more suited for <#C6A044SQH|helpdesk> :wink:

text: but yes, these usage questions are best suited to <#C6A044SQH|helpdesk>

elements.text: but yes, these usage questions are best suited to

text: Also I think the "not" character ^ for a set can only come at the front, so the other ^ characters count as normal characters which are then not replaced. I think this should work: `r"[^a-z\s]"`

elements.text: Also I think the "not" character ^ for a set can only come at the front, so the other ^ characters count as normal characters which are then not replaced. I think this should work:

text: Haha, Julius is right. I assumed it to be a stupid mistake, yet soooo stupid, *sigh* :slightly_smiling_face:
